p: It was shown that low winter temperatures correlated with both influenza incidence and global mortality, which mainly affected those aged 65 and older [ 21, 23, 24]. Low UV indexes could also be associated with global mortality. Indeed, data from six Northern European countries reported to the EuroMOMO project showed an excess mortality from all causes between the beginning of Januaries and the end of Februaries in 2010â€“2018, and coincided with IV epidemic peaks, low temperature and low UV indexes.
